fullText: The revival of William Finn and James Lapine's 1992 musical about a gay man, his ex-wife, his boyfriend, and his son feels both dated and timeless, both small and enormous.

bwwExcerpt: If this Lincoln Center Theater production, directed (like all the earlier New York incarnations) by Lapine, has any serious faults, they arise from that agenda.
